Major_Arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Initial Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting, key characters, and initial conflicts surrounding the ghost town and personal desires.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgia and Barroom Disagreement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the main character's nostalgic feelings and introduces a secondary conflict in a saloon setting regarding a visit to the ghost town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Woman's Nostalgia
Bar Conversation and Ghost Town Disagreement

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Ghost Town and Discovery of Airport Plan
sub_scenes.description: Nan journeys to the ghost town and unexpectedly overhears a conversation revealing plans to build an airport, leading to her distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Solo Ride to Ghost Town
Modern Visitors and Airport Development Plan
Nan Overhears the Airport Plan and Reacts

Major_Arcs.title: Personal Reflections and Ghost Town Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc delves into Nan's personal reflections on a past relationship and her direct confrontation with the construction workers at the ghost town.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Past and Present Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Nan's internal thoughts on a past relationship contrast with her immediate, physical confrontation at the ghost town, highlighting her emotional state and direct action.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal

Major_Arcs.title: Family Business, Father-Daughter Conflict, and Emotional Distress
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on business discussions related to the airport, escalating father-daughter conflict, and Nan's resulting emotional breakdown.

sub_scenes.title: Business Talk and Family Tension
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about the airport and cattle are intertwined with growing tension and disapproval from Nan's father, leading to a personal confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Horses and Father's Disapproval

Major_Arcs.title: Seeking Guidance, Business Obligations, and Romantic Ultimatum
Major_Arcs.description: Nan receives conflicting advice, engages in business dealings related to horses, and confronts Cal with an ultimatum about their relationship and business.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Advice and Determination
sub_scenes.description: Nan is given various pieces of advice by family and household staff, which leads her to seek out Cal directly, driven by a need for clarity.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Determination and Pursuit of Cal
Business Deal with Cowboys and Urgency

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal with an ultimatum, which leads to defiance and his departure, setting the stage for a time of loneliness and later reconciliation efforts.

sub_scenes.title: Loneliness and Belated Confession
sub_scenes.description: Following Cal's departure, Nan experiences loneliness, prompting her to seek him out and confess her true feelings after a period of internal struggle.

Major_Arcs.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
Major_Arcs.description: A severe weather event interrupts Nan and Cal's personal issues, shifting the narrative to a community-wide crisis and collective action.

sub_scenes.title: Interruption and Initial Concern
sub_scenes.description: Nan's confession to Cal is interrupted by a weather warning, introducing a new external crisis and shifting the narrative focus to community concerns.

sub_scenes.title: Collective Action and Hope Amidst Crisis
sub_scenes.description: The community mobilizes to address the weather crisis, moving from initial concern to planning and action, culminating in a hopeful resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: The Fodder Plane
Assessing the Situation and Lingering Concerns

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Conflicting Perceptions of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and explores varied reactions to his forceful personality and violent actions, setting him up as a central figure.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Forceful Introduction and Community Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through a display of force, eliciting diverse reactions and opinions from the townspeople regarding his character and methods.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dangerous Casanova's Display of Force
Conflicting Views on Chane Benson's Heroism and Manners
Beyond Brute Force: Maturity and Civilization

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Obsession and Confrontation with Family
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's fascination with guns and violent figures like Chane Benson, leading to family concern and confrontations.

sub_scenes.title: Family Concern over Jeff's Gun Obsession
sub_scenes.description: Family members discuss Jeff's unhealthy obsession with guns and violence, reflecting on his past and initiating a direct confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing about Brother Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Initiating a Talk about Jeff's Gun Handling
Mother's Disappointment and Desire for Decency
Comparison to Chane Benson and Criticism of Clyde Surrett
Defense of Chane Benson and Mocking Duel with Clyde Surrett

Major_Arcs.title: Intervention, Reassurance, and Looming Danger
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts efforts to guide Jeff away from Benson's influence, offering reassurance and affection, but foreshadowing continued trouble and danger.

sub_scenes.title: Efforts to Guide Jeff and Foreshadowing
sub_scenes.description: The mother resolves to help Jeff, receiving reassurance from Clyde, while a narrative voice foreshadows impending trouble despite moments of affection and hope. Sally encounters Mr. Benson and rejects his advice.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Shared Responsibility for Jeff's Upbringing
Affection and Hope for Future Happiness
Reflection on Blissful Ignorance and Looming Trouble
Advice from Mr. Benson to Sally
Chane Benson's Cold Demeanor and Silent Observation
Rejection of Brother's Influence and Disdain for Young Boys

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation with Benson and Clyde's Determination
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a direct confrontation with Chane Benson, Clyde's intervention, and his resolute decision to fight against Benson's influence.

sub_scenes.title: Direct Confrontation with Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: Surrett confronts Benson, questioning his intentions, followed by Clyde's intervention and firm stance against Benson and the violence he represents.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Questioning of Benson's Intentions
Benson's Evasive Response and Assertion of Staying
Clyde's Intervention and Warning to Benson
Surrett's Further Inquiry and Clyde's Resolve to Stay
Clyde's Declaration of Action and Protection

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner with Benson and Escalating Tensions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dinner invitation to Chane Benson, its unsettling atmosphere, and the escalation of tensions leading to physical violence.

sub_scenes.title: The Dinner Invitation Strategy
sub_scenes.description: Sally proposes inviting Chane Benson to dinner as a diplomatic approach, with narrative reflections on decency and courtesy, leading to a time skip to the dinner itself.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Benson and Dinner Invitation
Narrative Reflection on Decency and Courtesy
Narrative Time Skip and Jeff's Shift in Viewpoint

sub_scenes.title: Unsettling Dinner and Violent Outbreak
sub_scenes.description: The dinner scene becomes tense and inappropriate with a shooting demonstration by Benson, escalating into outdoor confrontations, accusations, and physical violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Dinner Shooting Demonstration and Sally's Concern
Chane Benson's Provocation and Jeff's Anger

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Escape and Showdown with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Jeff's escape, his confrontation with Chane Benson, and the subsequent fight and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Nighttime Standoff
sub_scenes.description: Sally urges Jeff to escape, revealing Benson's pursuit of Clyde. Jeff escapes and confronts Benson in a nighttime standoff with drawn guns.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and the Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: The Fight and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson agree to a fistfight, leaving Sally and Clyde in anxious anticipation, culminating in Jeff's victorious return and a hopeful outlook.

narrative_arcs.title: Headline Change and Relief at Return

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Dynamics and Hiring Steve Daley
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces ranch life, initial conflicts, and the hiring of Steve Daley to address ranch troubles.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Conflict and New Hire Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A physical altercation on the ranch sets the stage for introducing Steve Daley as a new hire, meant to help with ranch difficulties.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and the Boss
Explanation of Steve's Hiring and Approval

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Operations, Concerns, and Town Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc illustrates ranch operations, growing concerns about range wars and cattle, and culminates in a town confrontation where Long Lady demonstrates her strength.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Logistics and Range War Fears
sub_scenes.description: Ranch logistics are shown as Long Lady arrives, while concerns about a potential range war and missing cattle escalate among the ranch hands.

sub_scenes.title: Town Visit and Long Lady's Assertiveness
sub_scenes.description: Long Lady visits town to carry out orders, facing skepticism and threats, ultimately demonstrating her physical prowess in a confrontation.

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Ranch Decisions and Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy's firm decisions about managing her ranch, her evolving feelings for Steve, and their eventual romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Firmness and Romantic Development
sub_scenes.description: Betsy makes firm decisions about her ranch, particularly regarding gunmen, while her romantic feelings for Steve Daley develop, culminating in a heartfelt exchange.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution and Commitment
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve confront the conflict of his profession, confess their love, and resolve their issues with Steve agreeing to give up gunfighting for Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and the Dilemma of Profession

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Steve's Past Reflections
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts a confrontation with Bridges and his men at the ranch, contrasted with Steve's internal reflection on his past actions and mistakes.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Past Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Bridges and his men confront Betsy about ranch issues, while Steve reflects on past foolishness and significant past events, creating a juxtaposition of external conflict and internal contemplation.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Bridges and his Men

Major_Arcs.title: Steve's Violent Decision and Pursuit to Devil's Pass
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Steve's decision to resort to violence, arm himself, and head to Devil's Pass, despite Betsy's pleas and her subsequent pursuit.

sub_scenes.title: Decision for Violence and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Steve decides to arm himself and go to Devil's Pass to confront the gunslinger, overriding Betsy's desire for a peaceful resolution and setting off on a dangerous path.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Decision to Arm Himself and Go to Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Pursuit and the Gunfight at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy follows Steve to Devil's Pass, hearing gunfire upon arrival, indicating a violent confrontation is underway, leading to her witnessing and being caught in the crossfire.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization and Pursuit of Steve
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Aftermath of Violence and Romantic Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the immediate aftermath of the gunfight, Betsy's reaction, and the subsequent reconciliation and reaffirmation of love between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Aftermath and Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Betsy faints due to the shock of violence, and Steve provides comfort and reassurance as she recovers, leading to a moment of emotional tenderness.

Major_Arcs.title: New Ranch Conflicts and Range War Tensions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces new ranch-related conflicts, focusing on range disputes and cattle issues, separate from the main storyline involving Benson and Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Argument and Ranch Troubles Begin
sub_scenes.description: A seemingly unrelated argument is presented, followed by the introduction of new ranch troubles and tensions related to range disputes and cattle.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubling News at the Ranch
Discussion Among Intruders and Threat of Gunplay

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Reconciliation and New Proposals
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Dave and Carrie's relationship, their reconciliation after conflict, and a marriage proposal amidst personal reflections and external interruptions.

sub_scenes.title: Apology, Reconciliation, and Romantic Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Dave apologizes to Carrie, leading to reconciliation and a discussion about their relationship and past feelings, culminating in a relaxed social invitation.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Fred and Brotherly Matters
Carrie's Introspective Thoughts on Love and Anticipation
Intrusion and Questioning by Fred Gordon

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Proposal and Acceptance
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie engage in a direct conversation resolving misunderstandings and confessing their feelings, leading to a marriage proposal and joyful acceptance.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Rebuttal and Declaration of Love
Desire for Reconciliation and Invitation for Relaxation
Carrie's Reflection on Love for Fred and His Qualities
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Marriage Proposal

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Conflict and Emotional Aftermath
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with the conflict surrounding the Carlton contract, Carrie's confrontation with Carlton, and the subsequent emotional fallout and reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Contract Dispute and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Dave about the Carlton contract, leading to accusations and emotional outbursts, followed by Carrie reflecting on past manipulation by Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation of Deception and Plea of Love
Confrontation with Dave, Pete, and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton directly, justifies her actions to Dave and Carlton, and experiences emotional release, leading to reconciliation with Dave and Fred.

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Confessions and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on emotional confessions, romantic revelations, and culminates in a marriage proposal and acceptance between Carrie and Dave.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Reflection and Dave's Inquiry
sub_scenes.description: Fred reflects on Carrie's impactful words, while Dave encounters Carrie and probes her true feelings, setting the stage for emotional confessions.

narrative_arcs.title: Chance Encounter and Emotional Inquiry in Town

sub_scenes.title: Revelation, Flashback, and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's illness leads to revelations about the beef contract, emotional flashbacks, and a passionate reunion with Fred, resolving their romantic tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Young Man's Confession and Carrie's Initial Reaction
Carrie's Flashback of Shame, Regret, and Happiness

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Wounded Arrival and Medical Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dirk's wounded arrival, the immediate medical crisis, and Carrie's past relationship with Dirk as she cares for him.

sub_scenes.title: Sudden Arrival and Immediate Care
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives wounded, startling Carrie and prompting her to immediately provide care, reflecting on their long history together.

Major_Arcs.title: Investigation, Confrontation, and Ranch Tensions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows an investigation into Dirk's situation, a confrontation at the ranch, and escalating tensions related to Dirk's actions.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation Begins
sub_scenes.description: An old man expresses concern and begins investigating Dirk's situation, while Rance Cready arrives at the ranch, initiating a confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Encounter with Chris Ransome
Escalating Tension and Accusation at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Negotiation for Dirk's Custody
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's crime is revealed, leading to negotiation between the lawman and Dirk's associate regarding Dirk's custody and care, marked by internal conflict and emotional tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Negotiation for Dirk's Custody and Care
Lawman's Internal Conflict and Shifting Perspective

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Confessions and Escape Plans
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on romantic confessions between Chris and Rance, Chris's lingering doubts, and their conflicting plans regarding Dirk's escape.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confessions and Lingering Doubts
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confess their love, but Chris expresses lingering doubts and seeks reassurance about the sincerity and reality of their feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Desire and Lingering Doubt

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Loyalties and Escape Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Chris's reflections on past misjudgments lead to her proposing an escape plan for Dirk, which Rance firmly rejects, highlighting their conflicting loyalties and intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Rejection and Internal Conflict
Confrontation about Intentions and Daybreak Departure

Major_Arcs.title: The Chase, Shootout, and Reunion in Mexico
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the intense chase, the violent shootout, and the eventual reunion of Dirk and Rance in Mexico, marking a resolution to their immediate conflict.

sub_scenes.title: The Pursuit and Violent Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The chase intensifies, leading to a violent confrontation where the Marshal issues a deadly ultimatum, gunfire erupts, and Chris is forced to shoot someone.

narrative_arcs.title: Justification for Deadly Force and Injury Assessment
Desperate Escape Plan and Moral Objection

sub_scenes.title: Escape to Mexico and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris decide to escape, parting ways at the border, while Rance, despite injury, stubbornly pursues Dirk and they eventually reunite in Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Parting Ways and Confession of Love

Major_Arcs.title: Recovery, Reassurance, and Wedding Day
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Rance's recovery, the reassurance and confessions between Chris and Rance, culminating in their wedding day and unexpected arrivals.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Emotional Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Chris finds Rance injured, leading to his recovery at home, where he receives reassurance from his father and Chris about the reality of recent events and their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Sleepless Vigil and Lingering Danger
Father's Tactful Exit and Anticipation of Private Discussion
Clarification of Father's Integrity and Dirk's Involvement
Declaration of Gratitude and Undying Affection

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Unexpected Guests
sub_scenes.description: The narrative culminates on the wedding day, marked by anticipation, apprehension, and the unexpected and ultimately positive arrival of Dirk and the Marshal.

narrative_arcs.title: Acclamation and Anecdotal Praise for Rance
